text:
I'm running about 75 virtual hosts and I just upgraded to version 2.0.47 and the
<VirtualHost> directive is both incompatible and awkward to use in 2.0.

Specifically, I have to specify a port number for every virtual host as well as
the namedvirtualhost directive. I did get it to work - but it wasn't pretty and
it was somewhat disapointing. With 1.3 I didn't have to specify the port.

If I specify no port it assumes port 0 - a bzzare assumption.
creator: marc@perkel.com
slive@apache.org
text:
You shouldn't need to specify the port number (although it is not
a bad idea to do so).

Try 
Listen 80
in httpd.conf before your first virtual host.
yes - I shouldn't need to - but I do. And that's why I reported the bug.
creator: marc@perkel.com
slive@apache.org
text:
Please try my suggested change to httpd.conf.

I'm fairly sure this problem was recently fixed anyway, however.

creator: marc@perkel.com
text:
Oh - I do already have Listen 80 set in httpd.conf. I also have Listen 443 set.
That's why I was so confused by the way it behaved. 

When you say receintly fixed ... I'm running 2.0.47 so is that receint enough?

btw - except for a few glitches - I love it. I was almost ready to buy new
hardware to handle the traffic and now the load level dropped dramatically as
well as memory usage.
